column1: Bladder biopsy is a procedure that involves removing a small piece of tissue from the bladder.
A bladder biopsy can be done as part of a cystoscopy (telescopic examination of the inside of the bladder).
This test is most often done to check for cancer of the bladder or urethra.
The type of cancer can be determined from the biopsy sample.
Also contact your health care provider if: - You have pain, chills, or a fever.
